table-wrap.anchoringText: Establishing uniform best practices for waterflood management makes sense only if the best practices are general in nature rather than detailed and prescriptive. Each individual reservoir should have its own best practices. Figure 7 illustrates how the water-cut trend changed after applying waterflood management best practices. Operating expense (OpEx) savings from reduced water handling and facility bottlenecks were very significant. Table 1 highlights some basic waterflooding best practices.
